snippet: After several failed efforts to restore confidence in their struggling banks, European governments face growing pressure to change course and give the European Union more power to shore up the region's shakier lenders. Calls for a reassessment of...
abstract: After several failed efforts to restore confidence in their struggling banks, European governments face growing pressure to change course and give the European Union more power to shore up the region's shakier lenders. Calls for a reassessment of current policy have been prompted by a new crisis in Spain, where the government took a controlling stake in Bankia, the country's third-largest bank by assets, late on Wednesday, Stephen Castle reports in The New York Times.

headline.main: Europe May Need More Power to Deal With Bank Crisis
